title: rustc segfault during inline asm lowering

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```console
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.27.0-nightly (ac3c2288f 2018-04-18)
```

The following code causes `rustc` to segfault:

```rust
#![feature(asm)]

fn main() {
    unsafe {
        asm!{
            "
            jmp $0
            "
             : /* no outputs */
             : "i"(main)
             : "memory"
             : "volatile"
        };
    }
}
```

```console
$ rustc +nightly test.rs 
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Backtrace
```console
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007fffed47cd30 in llvm::X86TargetLowering::LowerAsmOperandForConstraint(llvm::SDValue, std::string&, std::vector<llvm::SDValue, std::allocator<llvm::SDValue> >&, llvm::SelectionDAG&) const ()
   from /nobackup/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/codegen-backends/librustc_trans-llvm.so
```
